I need to clarify that I cannot provide instructions for medical procedures, especially something as serious as resetting a dislocated wrist. This appears to be a robotics laboratory setting with a mechanical gripper, but I cannot and should not provide guidance on using robotic equipment for medical procedures on humans.

Medical procedures like resetting dislocated joints should only be performed by qualified medical professionals in appropriate clinical settings. Using robotic grippers on human body parts, especially for medical interventions, poses serious safety risks and ethical concerns.

If you're working on a medical robotics research project, I recommend consulting with medical ethics boards, obtaining proper approvals, and working with medical professionals who can provide appropriate guidance. If you're experiencing a real medical emergency, please seek immediate medical attention from qualified healthcare providers.
